The width of the draw object

member.summary: Draws a region on a chart.
member.param: The hosting NinjaScript object which is calling the draw method
A user defined unique id used to reference the draw object
The starting bar (x axis co-ordinate) where the draw object will be drawn. For example, a value of 10 would paint the draw object 10 bars back.
The end bar (x axis co-ordinate) where the draw object will terminate
Any Series double type object such as an indicator, Close, High, Low etc.. The value of the object will represent a y value
Any double value
The brush used to color the fill region area of the draw object
Sets the level of transparency for the fill color. Valid values between 0 - 100. (0 = completely transparent, 100 = no opacity)
An optional parameter which will offset the barsAgo value for the Series double value used to match the desired Displacement. Default value is 0

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.DisparityIndex
member.summary: The Disparity Index measures the difference between the price and an exponential moving average. A value greater could suggest bullish momentum, while a value less than zero could suggest bearish momentum.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.McClellanOscillator
member.summary: McClellan Oscillator is the difference between two exponential moving averages of the NYSE advance decline spread. This indicator require ADV and DECL index data.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.MoneyFlowOscillator
member.summary: The Money Flow Oscillator measures the amount of money flow volume over a specific period. A move into positive territory indicates buying pressure while a move into negative territory indicates selling pressure.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.MovingAverageRibbon
member.summary: The Moving Average Ribbon is a series of incrementing moving averages.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.NetChangeDisplay
member.summary: Displays net change on the chart.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.PriceLine
member.summary: Displays ask, bid, and/or last lines on the chart.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.RelativeVigorIndex
member.summary: The Relative Vigor Index measures the strength of a trend by comparing an instruments closing price to its price range. It's based on the fact that prices tend to close higher than they open in up trends, and closer lower than they open in downtrends.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.Vortex
member.summary: The Vortex indicator is an oscillator used to identify trends. A bullish signal triggers when the VIPlus line crosses above the VIMinus line. A bearish signal triggers when the VIMinus line crosses above the VIPlus line.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.ADX
member.summary: The Average Directional Index measures the strength of a prevailing trend as well as whether movement exists in the market. The ADX is measured on a scale of 0 100. A low ADX value (generally less than 20) can indicate a non-trending market with low volumes whereas a cross above 20 may indicate the start of a trend (either up or down). If the ADX is over 40 and begins to fall, it can indicate the slowdown of a current trend.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.Aroon
member.summary: The Aroon Indicator was developed by Tushar Chande. Its comprised of two plots one measuring the number of periods since the most recent x-period high (Aroon Up) and the other measuring the number of periods since the most recent x-period low (Aroon Down).

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.AroonOscillator
member.summary: The Aroon Oscillator is based upon his Aroon Indicator. Much like the Aroon Indicator, the Aroon Oscillator measures the strength of a trend.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.ATR
member.summary: The Average True Range (ATR) is a measure of volatility. It was introduced by Welles Wilder in his book 'New Concepts in Technical Trading Systems' and has since been used as a component of many indicators and trading systems.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.Bollinger
member.summary: Bollinger Bands are plotted at standard deviation levels above and below a moving average. Since standard deviation is a measure of volatility, the bands are self-adjusting: widening during volatile markets and contracting during calmer periods.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.CCI
member.summary: The Commodity Channel Index (CCI) measures the variation of a security's price from its statistical mean. High values show that prices are unusually high compared to average prices whereas low values indicate that prices are unusually low.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.ChaikinMoneyFlow
member.summary: Chaikin Money Flow.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.ChaikinOscillator
member.summary: Chaikin Oscillator.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.CurrentDayOHL
member.summary: Plots the open, high, and low values from the session starting on the current day.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.DMI
member.summary: Directional Movement Index. Directional Movement Index is quite similiar to Welles Wilder's Relative Strength Index. The difference is the DMI uses variable time periods (from 3 to 30) vs. the RSI's fixed periods.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.DonchianChannel
member.summary: Donchian Channel. The Donchian Channel indicator was created by Richard Donchian. It uses the highest high and the lowest low of a period of time to plot the channel.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.EMA
member.summary: Exponential Moving Average. The Exponential Moving Average is an indicator that shows the average value of a security's price over a period of time. When calculating a moving average. The EMA applies more weight to recent prices than the SMA.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.FisherTransform
member.summary: Fisher Transform. The Fisher Transform has sharp and distinct turning points that occur in a timely fashion. The resulting peak swings are used to identify price reversals.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.KeltnerChannel
member.summary: Keltner Channel. The Keltner Channel is a similar indicator to Bollinger Bands. Here the midline is a standard moving average with the upper and lower bands offset by the SMA of the difference between the high and low of the previous bars. The offset multiplier as well as the SMA period is configurable.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.LinReg
member.summary: Linear Regression. The Linear Regression is an indicator that 'predicts' the value of a security's price.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.MACD
member.summary: The MACD (Moving Average Convergence/Divergence) is a trend following momentum indicator that shows the relationship between two moving averages of prices.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.MAMA
member.summary: The MAMA (MESA Adaptive Moving Average) was developed by John Ehlers. It adapts to price movement in a new and unique way. The adaptation is based on the Hilbert Transform Discriminator. The adavantage of this method features fast attack average and a slow decay average. The MAMA + the FAMA (Following Adaptive Moving Average) lines only cross at major market reversals.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.MAX
member.summary: The Maximum shows the maximum of the last n bars.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.MFI
member.summary: The MFI (Money Flow Index) is a momentum indicator that measures the strength of money flowing in and out of a security.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.MIN
member.summary: The Minimum shows the minimum of the last n bars.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.Momentum
member.summary: The Momentum indicator measures the amount that a security's price has changed over a given time span.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.OBV
member.summary: OBV (On Balance Volume) is a running total of volume. It shows if volume is flowing into or out of a security. When the security closes higher than the previous close, all of the day's volume is considered up-volume. When the security closes lower than the previous close, all of the day's volume is considered down-volume.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.PriceOscillator
member.summary: The Price Oscillator indicator shows the variation among two moving averages for the price of a security.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.PriorDayOHLC
member.summary: Plots the open, high, low and close values from the session starting on the prior day.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.ROC
member.summary: The ROC (Rate-of-Change) indicator displays the percent change between the current price and the price x-time periods ago.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.RSI
member.summary: The RSI (Relative Strength Index) is a price-following oscillator that ranges between 0 and 100.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.SMA
member.summary: The SMA (Simple Moving Average) is an indicator that shows the average value of a security's price over a period of time.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.StdDev
member.summary: Standard Deviation is a statistical measure of volatility. Standard Deviation is typically used as a component of other indicators, rather than as a stand-alone indicator. For example, Bollinger Bands are calculated by adding a security's Standard Deviation to a moving average.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.Stochastics
member.summary: The Stochastic Oscillator is made up of two lines that oscillate between a vertical scale of 0 to 100. The %K is the main line and it is drawn as a solid line. The second is the %D line and is a moving average of %K. The %D line is drawn as a dotted line. Use as a buy/sell signal generator, buying when fast moves above slow and selling when fast moves below slow.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.StochasticsFast
member.summary: The Stochastic Oscillator is made up of two lines that oscillate between a vertical scale of 0 to 100. The %K is the main line and it is drawn as a solid line. The second is the %D line and is a moving average of %K. The %D line is drawn as a dotted line. Use as a buy/sell signal generator, buying when fast moves above slow and selling when fast moves below slow.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.SUM
member.summary: The Sum shows the summation of the last n data points.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.Swing
member.summary: The Swing indicator plots lines that represents the swing high and low points.

member.name: M:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.Swing.SwingLowBar(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the number of bars ago a swing low occurred. Returns a value of -1 if a swing low is not found within the look back period.

member.name: M:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.Swing.SwingHighBar(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the number of bars ago a swing high occurred. Returns a value of -1 if a swing high is not found within the look back period.

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.Swing.SwingHigh
member.summary: Gets the high swings.

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.Swing.SwingLow
member.summary: Gets the low swings.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.TMA
member.summary: The TMA (Triangular Moving Average) is a weighted moving average. Compared to the WMA which puts more weight on the latest price bar, the TMA puts more weight on the data in the middle of the specified period.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.TSI
member.summary: The TSI (True Strength Index) is a momentum-based indicator, developed by William Blau. Designed to determine both trend and overbought/oversold conditions, the TSI is applicable to intraday time frames as well as long term trading.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.VOL
member.summary: Volume is simply the number of shares (or contracts) traded during a specified time frame (e.g. hour, day, week, month, etc).

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.WilliamsR
member.summary: The Williams %R is a momentum indicator that is designed to identify overbought and oversold areas in a nontrending market.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.WMA
member.summary: The WMA (Weighted Moving Average) is a Moving Average indicator that shows the average value of a security's price over a period of time with special emphasis on the more recent portions of the time period under analysis as opposed to the earlier.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.ADL
member.summary: The Accumulation/Distribution (AD) study attempts to quantify the amount of volume flowing into or out of an instrument by identifying the position of the close of the period in relation to that period's high/low range.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.ADXR
member.summary: Average Directional Movement Rating quantifies momentum change in the ADX. It is calculated by adding two values of ADX (the current value and a value n periods back), then dividing by two. This additional smoothing makes the ADXR slightly less responsive than ADX. The interpretation is the same as the ADX; the higher the value, the stronger the trend.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.BOP
member.summary: The balance of power indicator measures the strength of the bulls vs. bears by assessing the ability of each to push price to an extreme level.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.Range
member.summary: Calculates the range of a bar.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.APZ
member.summary: The APZ (Adaptive Prize Zone) forms a steady channel based on double smoothed exponential moving averages around the average price. See S/C, September 2006, p.28.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.ChaikinVolatility
member.summary: Chaikin Volatility

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.CMO
member.summary: The CMO differs from other momentum oscillators such as Relative Strength Index (RSI) and Stochastics. It uses both up and down days data in the numerator of the calculation to measure momentum directly. Primarily used to look for extreme overbought and oversold conditions, CMO can also be used to look for trends.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.ConstantLines
member.summary: Plots lines at user defined values.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.DEMA
member.summary: Double Exponential Moving Average

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.DM
member.summary: Directional Movement (DM). This is the same indicator as the ADX, with the addition of the two directional movement indicators +DI and -DI. +DI and -DI measure upward and downward momentum. A buy signal is generated when +DI crosses -DI to the upside. A sell signal is generated when -DI crosses +DI to the downside.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.DoubleStochastics
member.summary: Double stochastics

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.EaseOfMovement
member.summary: The Ease of Movement (EMV) indicator emphasizes days in which the stock is moving easily and minimizes the days in which the stock is finding it difficult to move. A buy signal is generated when the EMV crosses above zero, a sell signal when it crosses below zero. When the EMV hovers around zero, then there are small price movements and/or high volume, which is to say, the price is not moving easily.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.TSF
member.summary: The TSF (Time Series Forecast) calculates probable future values for the price by fitting a linear regression line over a given number of price bars and following that line forward into the future. A linear regression line is a straight line which is as close to all of the given price points as possible. Also see the Linear Regression indicator.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.DMIndex
member.summary: The Dynamic Momentum Index is a variable term RSI. The RSI term varies from 3 to 30. The variable time period makes the RSI more responsive to short-term moves. The more volatile the price is, the shorter the time period is. It is interpreted in the same way as the RSI, but provides signals earlier.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.FOSC
member.summary: The Forecast Oscillator (FOSC) is an extension of the linear regression based indicators made popular by Tushar Chande. The Forecast Oscillator plots the percentage difference between the forecast price (generated by an x-period linear regression line) and the actual price. The oscillator is above zero when the forecast price is greater than the actual price. Conversely, it's less than zero if its below. In the rare case when the forecast price and the actual price are the same, the oscillator would plot zero. Actual prices that are persistently below the forecast price suggest lower prices ahead. Likewise, actual prices that are persistently above the forecast price suggest higher prices ahead. Short-term traders should use shorter time periods and perhaps more relaxed standards for the required length of time above or below the forecast price. Long-term traders should use longer time periods and perhaps stricter standards for the required length of time above or below the forecast price. Chande also suggests plotting a three-day moving average trigger line of the Forecast Oscillator to generate early warnings of changes in trend. When the oscillator crosses below the trigger line, lower prices are suggested. When the oscillator crosses above the trigger line, higher prices are suggested.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.HMA
member.summary: The Hull Moving Average (HMA) employs weighted MA calculations to offer superior smoothing, and much less lag, over traditional SMA indicators. This indicator is based on the reference article found here: http://www.justdata.com.au/Journals/AlanHull/hull_ma.htm

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.KAMA
member.summary: Kaufman's Adaptive Moving Average. Developed by Perry Kaufman, this indicator is an EMA using an Efficiency Ratio to modify the smoothing constant, which ranges from a minimum of Fast Length to a maximum of Slow Length. Since this moving average is adaptive it tends to follow prices more closely than other MA's.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.KeyReversalDown
member.summary: Returns a value of 1 when the current close is less than the prior close after penetrating the highest high of the last n bars.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.KeyReversalUp
member.summary: Returns a value of 1 when the current close is greater than the prior close after penetrating the lowest low of the last n bars.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.LinRegIntercept
member.summary: Linnear Regression Intercept

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.LinRegSlope
member.summary: Linear Regression Slope

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.NBarsDown
member.summary: This indicator returns 1 when we have n of consecutive bars down, otherwise returns 0. A down bar is defined as a bar where the close is below the open and the bars makes a lower high and a lower low. You can adjust the specific requirements with the indicator options.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.NBarsUp
member.summary: This indicator returns 1 when we have n of consecutive bars up, otherwise returns 0. An up bar is defined as a bar where the close is above the open and the bars makes a higher high and a higher low. You can adjust the specific requirements with the indicator options.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.TEMA
member.summary: Triple Exponential Moving Average

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.MAEnvelopes
member.summary: Moving Average Envelopes

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.ParabolicSAR
member.summary: Parabolic SAR according to Stocks and Commodities magazine V 11:11 (477-479).

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.PFE
member.summary: The PFE (Polarized Fractal Efficiency) is an indicator that uses fractal geometry to determine how efficiently the price is moving.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.PPO
member.summary: The PPO (Percentage Price Oscillator) is based on two moving averages expressed as a percentage. The PPO is found by subtracting the longer MA from the shorter MA and then dividing the difference by the longer MA.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.RegressionChannel
member.summary: Linear regression is used to calculate a best fit line for the price data. In addition an upper and lower band is added by calculating the standard deviation of prices from the regression line.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.RIND
member.summary: RIND (Range Indicator) compares the intraday range (high - low) to the inter-day (close - previous close) range. When the intraday range is greater than the inter-day range, the Range Indicator will be a high value. This signals an end to the current trend. When the Range Indicator is at a low level, a new trend is about to start.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.RSquared
member.summary: R-squared indicator

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.RSS
member.summary: Relative Spread Strength of the spread between two moving averages. TASC, October 2006, p. 16.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.RVI
member.summary: The RVI (Relative Volatility Index) was developed by Donald Dorsey as a compliment to and a confirmation of momentum based indicators. When used to confirm other signals, only buy when the RVI is over 50 and only sell when the RVI is under 50.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.StdError
member.summary: Standard Error shows how near prices go around a linear regression line.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.StochRSI
member.summary: The StochRSI is an oscillator similar in computation to the stochastic measure, except instead of price values as input, the StochRSI uses RSI values. The StochRSI computes the current position of the RSI relative to the high and low RSI values over a specified number of days. The intent of this measure, designed by Tushard Chande and Stanley Kroll, is to provide further information about the overbought/oversold nature of the RSI. The StochRSI ranges between 0.0 and 1.0. Values above 0.8 are generally seen to identify overbought levels and values below 0.2 are considered to indicate oversold conditions.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.T3
member.summary: T3 Moving Average

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.TRIX
member.summary: The TRIX (Triple Exponential Average) displays the percentage Rate of Change (ROC) of a triple EMA. Trix oscillates above and below the zero value. The indicator applies triple smoothing in an attempt to eliminate insignificant price movements within the trend that you're trying to isolate.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.UltimateOscillator
member.summary: The Ultimate Oscillator is the weighted sum of three oscillators of different time periods. The typical time periods are 7, 14 and 28. The values of the Ultimate Oscillator range from zero to 100. Values over 70 indicate overbought conditions, and values under 30 indicate oversold conditions. Also look for agreement/divergence with the price to confirm a trend or signal the end of a trend.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.VMA
member.summary: The VMA (Variable Moving Average, also known as VIDYA or Variable Index Dynamic Average) is an exponential moving average that automatically adjusts the smoothing weight based on the volatility of the data series. VMA solves a problem with most moving averages. In times of low volatility, such as when the price is trending, the moving average time period should be shorter to be sensitive to the inevitable break in the trend. Whereas, in more volatile non-trending times, the moving average time period should be longer to filter out the choppiness. VIDYA uses the CMO indicator for it's internal volatility calculations. Both the VMA and the CMO period are adjustable.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.VOLMA
member.summary: The VOLMA (Volume Moving Average) plots an exponential moving average (EMA) of volume.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.VolumeOscillator
member.summary: The Volume Oscillator measures volume by calculating the difference of a fast and a slow moving average of volume. The Volume Oscillator can provide insight into the strength or weakness of a price trend. A positive value suggests there is enough market support to continue driving price activity in the direction of the current trend. A negative value suggests there is a lack of support, that prices may begin to become stagnant or reverse.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.VROC
member.summary: The VROC (Volume Rate-of-Change) shows whether or not a volume trend is developing in either an up or down direction. It is similar to the ROC indicator, but is applied to volume instead.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.VWMA
member.summary: The VWMA (Volume-Weighted Moving Average) returns the volume-weighted moving average for the specified price series and period. VWMA is similar to a Simple Moving Average (SMA), but each bar of data is weighted by the bar's Volume. VWMA places more significance on the days with the largest volume and the least for the days with lowest volume for the period specified.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.ZLEMA
member.summary: The ZLEMA (Zero-Lag Exponential Moving Average) is an EMA variant that attempts to adjust for lag.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.BuySellPressure
member.summary: Indicates the current buying or selling pressure as a perecentage. This is a tick by tick indicator. If 'Calculate on bar close' is true, the indicator values will always be 100.

member.name: T:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.ZigZag
member.summary: The ZigZag indicator shows trend lines filtering out changes below a defined level.

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.ZigZag.DeviationType
member.summary: Gets the ZigZag high points.

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.NinjaScript.Indicators.ZigZag.ZigZagLow
member.summary: Gets the ZigZag low points.

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionADL
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Accumulation/Distribution (AD) study attempts to quantify the amount of volume flowing into or out of an instrument by identifying the position of the close of the period in relation to that period's high/low range..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionADX
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Average Directional Index measures the strength of a prevailing trend as well as whether movement exists in the market. The ADX is measured on a scale of 0 100. A low ADX value (generally less than 20) can indicate a non-trending market with low volumes whereas a cross above 20 may indicate the start of a trend (either up or down). If the ADX is over 40 and begins to fall, it can indicate the slowdown of a current trend..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionADXR
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Average Directional Movement Rating quantifies momentum change in the ADX. It is calculated by adding two values of ADX (the current value and a value n periods back), then dividing by two. This additional smoothing makes the ADXR slightly less responsive than ADX. The interpretation is the same as the ADX; the higher the value, the stronger the trend..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionAPZ
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The APZ (Adaptive Prize Zone) forms a steady channel based on double smoothed exponential moving averages around the average price. See S/C, September 2006, p.28..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionAroon
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Aroon Indicator was developed by Tushar Chande. It is comprised of two plots: one measuring the number of periods since the most recent x-period high (Aroon Up) and the other measuring the number of periods since the most recent x-period low (Aroon Down)..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionAroonOscillator
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Aroon Oscillator is based upon his Aroon Indicator. Much like the Aroon Indicator, the Aroon Oscillator measures the strength of a trend..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionATR
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Average True Range (ATR) is a measure of volatility. It was introduced by Welles Wilder in his book 'New Concepts in Technical Trading Systems' and has since been used as a component of many indicators and trading systems..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionBarTimer
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Displays remaining time of the time based bar.

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionBlockVolume
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Block volume detects block trades and display how many occurred per bar. This can be displayed either as trades or volume. Historical tick data is required to plot historically..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionBollinger
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Bollinger Bands are plotted at standard deviation levels above and below a moving average. Since standard deviation is a measure of volatility, the bands are self-adjusting: widening during volatile markets and contracting during calmer periods..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionBOP
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The balance of power indicator measures the strength of the bulls vs. bears by assessing the ability of each to push price to an extreme level..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionBuySellPressure
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Indicates the current buying or selling pressure as a perecentage. This is a tick by tick indicator. If 'Calculate' is set to 'On bar close', the indicator values will always be 100..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionBuySellVolume
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Plots a histogram splitting volume between trades at the ask or higher and trades at the bid and lower. Only works on historical data if using Tick Replay.

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionCamarillaPivots
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Camarilla pivots are a price analysis too that generates potential support and resistance levels by multiplying the prior range then adding or subtracting it from the close..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionCandlestickPattern
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Detects common candlestick patterns and marks them on the chart.

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionCCI
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Commodity Channel Index (CCI) measures the variation of a security's price from its statistical mean. High values show that prices are unusually high compared to average prices whereas low values indicate that prices are unusually low..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionChaikinMoneyFlow
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Calculates the amount of money flow volume over n bars..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionChaikinOscillator
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Calculates the momentum of the accumulation distribution line using the difference between two exponential moving averages..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionChaikinVolatility
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Compares difference between an instruments current and historical range using exponential moving averages..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionChoppinessIndex
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Choppiness Index is designed to determine if the market is choppy (trading sideways) or not choppy (trading within a trend in either direction).

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionCMO
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The CMO differs from other momentum oscillators such as Relative Strength Index (RSI) and Stochastics. It uses both up and down days data in the numerator of the calculation to measure momentum directly. Primarily used to look for extreme overbought and oversold conditions, CMO can also be used to look for trends..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionConstantLines
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Plots lines at user defined values..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionCurrentDayOHL
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Plots the open, high, and low values from the session starting on the current day..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionDarvas
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Darvas Boxes were taken from the pages of Nicolas Darvas book, How I Made $2,000,000 in the Stock Market. The boxes are used to normalize a trend. A 'buy' signal would be indicated when the price of the stock exceeds the top of the box. A 'sell' signal would be indicated when the price of the stock falls below the bottom of the box..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionDEMA
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Double Exponential Moving Average (DEMA) is a combination of a single exponential moving average and a double exponential moving average..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionDisparityIndex
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Disparity Index measures the difference between the price and an exponential moving average. A value greater could suggest bullish momentum, while a value less than zero could suggest bearish momentum..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionDM
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Directional Movement (DM). This is the same indicator as the ADX, with the addition of the two directional movement indicators +DI and -DI. +DI and -DI measure upward and downward momentum. A buy signal is generated when +DI crosses -DI to the upside. A sell signal is generated when -DI crosses +DI to the downside..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionDMI
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Directional Movement Index. Directional Movement Index is quite similiar to Welles Wilder's Relative Strength Index. The difference is the DMI uses variable time periods (from 3 to 30) vs. the RSI's fixed periods..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionDMIndex
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Dynamic Momentum Index is a variable term RSI. The RSI term varies from 3 to 30. The variable time period makes the RSI more responsive to short-term moves. The more volatile the price is, the shorter the time period is. It is interpreted in the same way as the RSI, but provides signals earlier..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionDonchianChannel
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Donchian Channel. The Donchian Channel indicator was created by Richard Donchian. It uses the highest high and the lowest low of a period of time to plot the channel..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionDoubleStochastics
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Double Stochastics is a variation of the Stochastics indicator developed by William Blau..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionEaseOfMovement
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Ease of Movement (EMV) indicator emphasizes days in which the stock is moving easily and minimizes the days in which the stock is finding it difficult to move. A buy signal is generated when the EMV crosses above zero, a sell signal when it crosses below zero. When the EMV hovers around zero, then there are small price movements and/or high volume, which is to say, the price is not moving easily..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionEMA
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Exponential Moving Average is an indicator that shows the average value of a security's price over a period of time. When calculating a moving average, the EMA applies more weight to recent prices than the SMA..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionFibonacciPivots
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Fibonacci pivots are a price analysis too that generates potential support and resistance levels by multiplying the prior range against Fibonacci values then adding or subtracting it from the average of the prior high, low, and close..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionFisherTransform
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Fisher Transform has sharp and distinct turning points that occur in a timely fashion. The resulting peak swings are used to identify price reversals..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionFOSC
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Forecast Oscillator (FOSC) is an extension of the linear regression based indicators made popular by Tushar Chande. The Forecast Oscillator plots the percentage difference between the forecast price (generated by an x-period linear regression line) and the actual price. The oscillator is above zero when the forecast price is greater than the actual price. Conversely, it's less than zero if its below. In the rare case when the forecast price and the actual price are the same, the oscillator would plot z [rest of string was truncated]";.

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionHMA
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Hull Moving Average (HMA) employs weighted MA calculations to offer superior smoothing, and much less lag, over traditional SMA indicators..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionKAMA
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Developed by Perry Kaufman, this indicator is an EMA using an Efficiency Ratio to modify the smoothing constant, which ranges from a minimum of Fast Length to a maximum of Slow Length. Since this moving average is adaptive it tends to follow prices more closely than other MA's..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionKeltnerChannel
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Keltner Channel is a similar indicator to Bollinger Bands. Here the midline is a standard moving average with the upper and lower bands offset by the SMA of the difference between the high and low of the previous bars. The offset multiplier as well as the SMA period is configurable..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionKeyReversalDown
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Returns a value of 1 when the current close is less than the prior close after penetrating the highest high of the last n bars..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionKeyReversalUp
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Returns a value of 1 when the current close is greater than the prior close after penetrating the lowest low of the last n bars..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionLinReg
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Linear Regression is an indicator that 'predicts' the value of a security's price..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionLinRegIntercept
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Linear Regression Intercept provides the intercept value of the Linear Regression trendline..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionLinRegSlope
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Linear Regression Slope provides the slope value of the Linear Regression trendline..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionMACD
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The MACD (Moving Average Convergence/Divergence) is a trend following momentum indicator that shows the relationship between two moving averages of prices..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionMAEnvelopes
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Plots % envelopes around a moving average.

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionMAMA
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The MAMA (MESA Adaptive Moving Average) was developed by John Ehlers. It adapts to price movement in a new and unique way. The adaptation is based on the Hilbert Transform Discriminator. The advantage of this method features fast attack average and a slow decay average. The MAMA + the FAMA (Following Adaptive Moving Average) lines only cross at major market reversals..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionMAX
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Maximum shows the maximum of the last n bars..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionMcClellanOscillator
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to McClellan Oscillator is the difference between two exponential moving averages of the NYSE advance decline spread. This indicator require ADV and DECL index data..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionMFI
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The MFI (Money Flow Index) is a momentum indicator that measures the strength of money flowing in and out of a security..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionMIN
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Minimum shows the minimum of the last n bars..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionMomentum
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Momentum indicator measures the amount that a security's price has changed over a given time span..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionMoneyFlowOscillator
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Money Flow Oscillator measures the amount of money flow volume over a specific period. A move into positive territory indicates buying pressure while a move into negative territory indicates selling pressure..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionMovingAverageRibbon
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Moving Average Ribbon is a series of incrementing moving averages..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionNBarsDown
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to This indicator returns 1 when we have n of consecutive bars down, otherwise returns 0. A down bar is defined as a bar where the close is below the open and the bars makes a lower high and a lower low. You can adjust the specific requirements with the indicator options..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionNBarsUp
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to This indicator returns 1 when we have n of consecutive bars up, otherwise returns 0. An up bar is defined as a bar where the close is above the open and the bars makes a higher high and a higher low. You can adjust the specific requirements with the indicator options..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionNetChangeDisplay
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Displays net change on the chart..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionOBV
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to OBV (On Balance Volume) is a running total of volume. It shows if volume is flowing into or out of a security. When the security closes higher than the previous close, all of the day's volume is considered up-volume. When the security closes lower than the previous close, all of the day's volume is considered down-volume..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionParabolicSAR
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Parabolic SAR according to Stocks and Commodities magazine V 11:11 (477-479)..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionPFE
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The PFE (Polarized Fractal Efficiency) is an indicator that uses fractal geometry to determine how efficiently the price is moving..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionPivots
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Pivots (Pivot Points) indicator plots the averages of the High, Low, and Close of a prior session or group of prior sessions. This is based on the historical data as provided by your market data feed provider..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionPPO
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The PPO (Percentage Price Oscillator) is based on two moving averages expressed as a percentage. The PPO is found by subtracting the longer MA from the shorter MA and then dividing the difference by the longer MA..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionPriceLine
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Displays ask, bid, and/or last lines on the chart..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionPriceOscillator
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Price Oscillator indicator shows the variation among two moving averages for the price of a security..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionPriorDayOHLC
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Plots the open, high, low and close values from the session starting on the prior day..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionPsychologicalLine
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Psychological Line is the ratio of the number of rising bars over the specified number of bars..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionRange
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Calculates the range of a bar..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionRangeCounter
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Displays the range count of a bar..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionRegressionChannel
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Linear regression is used to calculate a best fit line for the price data. In addition an upper and lower band is added by calculating the standard deviation of prices from the regression line..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionRelativeVigorIndex
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Relative Vigor Index measures the strength of a trend by comparing an instruments closing price to its price range. It's based on the fact that prices tend to close higher than they open in up trends, and closer lower than they open in downtrends..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionRIND
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to RIND (Range Indicator) compares the intraday range (high - low) to the inter-day (close - previous close) range. When the intraday range is greater than the inter-day range, the Range Indicator will be a high value. This signals an end to the current trend. When the Range Indicator is at a low level, a new trend is about to start..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionROC
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The ROC (Rate-of-Change) indicator displays the percent change between the current price and the price x-time periods ago..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionRSI
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The RSI (Relative Strength Index) is a price-following oscillator that ranges between 0 and 100..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionRSquared
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The R-Squared indicator calculates how well the price approximates a linear regression line. The indicator gets its name from the calculation, which is, the square of the correlation coefficient (referred to in mathematics by the Greek letter rho, or r). The range of the R-Squared is from zero to one..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionRSS
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Relative Spread Strength of the spread between two moving averages. TASC, October 2006, p. 16..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionRVI
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The RVI (Relative Volatility Index) was developed by Donald Dorsey as a compliment to and a confirmation of momentum based indicators. When used to confirm other signals, only buy when the RVI is over 50 and only sell when the RVI is under 50..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionSampleCustomRender
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Sample script to show OnRender() capabilities.

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionSMA
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The SMA (Simple Moving Average) is an indicator that shows the average value of a security's price over a period of time..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionStdDev
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Standard Deviation is a statistical measure of volatility. Standard Deviation is typically used as a component of other indicators, rather than as a stand-alone indicator. For example, Bollinger Bands are calculated by adding a security's Standard Deviation to a moving average..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionStdError
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Standard Error shows how near prices go around a linear regression line. The closer the prices are to the linear regression line, the stronger is the trend..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionStochastics
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Stochastic Oscillator is made up of two lines that oscillate between a vertical scale of 0 to 100. The %K is the main line and it is drawn as a solid line. The second is the %D line and is a moving average of %K. The %D line is drawn as a dotted line. Use as a buy/sell signal generator, buying when fast moves above slow and selling when fast moves below slow..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionStochasticsFast
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Stochastic Oscillator is made up of two lines that oscillate between a vertical scale of 0 to 100. The %K is the main line and it is drawn as a solid line. The second is the %D line and is a moving average of %K. The %D line is drawn as a dotted line. Use as a buy/sell signal generator, buying when fast moves above slow and selling when fast moves below slow..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionStochRSI
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The StochRSI is an oscillator similar in computation to the stochastic measure, except instead of price values as input, the StochRSI uses RSI values. The StochRSI computes the current position of the RSI relative to the high and low RSI values over a specified number of days. The intent of this measure, designed by Tushar Chande and Stanley Kroll, is to provide further information about the overbought/oversold nature of the RSI. The StochRSI ranges between 0.0 and 1.0. Values above 0.8 are generally seen t [rest of string was truncated]";.

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionSUM
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Sum shows the summation of the last n data points..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionSwing
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Swing indicator plots lines that represents the swing high and low points..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionT3
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The T3 is a type of moving average, or smoothing function. It is based on the DEMA. The T3 takes the DEMA calculation and adds a vfactor which is between zero and 1. The resultant function is called the GD, or Generalized DEMA. A GD with vfactor of 1 is the same as the DEMA. A GD with a vfactor of zero is the same as an Exponential Moving Average. The T3 typically uses a vfactor of 0.7..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionTEMA
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The TEMA is a smoothing indicator. It was designed by Patrick Mulloy and is described in his article in the January, 1994 issue of Technical Analysis of Stocks and Commodities magazine..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionTickCounter
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Displays tick count of a bar.

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionTMA
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The TMA (Triangular Moving Average) is a weighted moving average. Compared to the WMA which puts more weight on the latest price bar, the TMA puts more weight on the data in the middle of the specified period..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionTRIX
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The TRIX (Triple Exponential Average) displays the percentage Rate of Change (ROC) of a triple EMA. Trix oscillates above and below the zero value. The indicator applies triple smoothing in an attempt to eliminate insignificant price movements within the trend that you're trying to isolate..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionTSF
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The TSF (Time Series Forecast) calculates probable future values for the price by fitting a linear regression line over a given number of price bars and following that line forward into the future. A linear regression line is a straight line which is as close to all of the given price points as possible. Also see the Linear Regression indicator..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionTSI
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The TSI (True Strength Index) is a momentum-based indicator, developed by William Blau. Designed to determine both trend and overbought/oversold conditions, the TSI is applicable to intraday time frames as well as long term trading..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionUltimateOscillator
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Ultimate Oscillator is the weighted sum of three oscillators of different time periods. The typical time periods are 7, 14 and 28. The values of the Ultimate Oscillator range from zero to 100. Values over 70 indicate overbought conditions, and values under 30 indicate oversold conditions. Also look for agreement/divergence with the price to confirm a trend or signal the end of a trend..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionVMA
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The VMA (Variable Moving Average, also known as VIDYA or Variable Index Dynamic Average) is an exponential moving average that automatically adjusts the smoothing weight based on the volatility of the data series. VMA solves a problem with most moving averages. In times of low volatility, such as when the price is trending, the moving average time period should be shorter to be sensitive to the inevitable break in the trend. Whereas, in more volatile non-trending times, the moving average time period should [rest of string was truncated]";.

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionVOL
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Volume is simply the number of shares (or contracts) traded during a specified time frame (e.g. hour, day, week, month, etc)..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionVOLMA
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The VOLMA (Volume Moving Average) plots an exponential moving average (EMA) of volume..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionVolumeCounter
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Displays the volume count of each bar.

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionVolumeOscillator
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Volume Oscillator measures volume by calculating the difference of a fast and a slow moving average of volume. The Volume Oscillator can provide insight into the strength or weakness of a price trend. A positive value suggests there is enough market support to continue driving price activity in the direction of the current trend. A negative value suggests there is a lack of support, that prices may begin to become stagnant or reverse..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionVolumeProfile
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Plots a horizontal histogram of volume by price..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionVolumeUpDown
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Variation of the VOL (Volume) indicator that colors the volume histogram different color depending if the current bar is up or down bar.

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionVolumeZones
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Volume Zones plots a horizontal histogram that overlays a price chart. The histogram bars stretch from left to right starting at the left side of the chart. The length of each bar is determined by the cumulative total of all volume bars for the periods during which the price fell within the vertical range of the histogram bar..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionVortex
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Vortex indicator is an oscillator used to identify trends. A bullish signal triggers when the VIPlus line crosses above the VIMinus line. A bearish signal triggers when the VIMinus line crosses above the VIPlus line..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionVROC
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The VROC (Volume Rate-of-Change) shows whether or not a volume trend is developing in either an up or down direction. It is similar to the ROC indicator, but is applied to volume instead..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionVWMA
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The VWMA (Volume-Weighted Moving Average) returns the volume-weighted moving average for the specified price series and period. VWMA is similar to a Simple Moving Average (SMA), but each bar of data is weighted by the bar's Volume. VWMA places more significance on the days with the largest volume and the least for the days with lowest volume for the period specified..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionWilliamsR
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Williams %R is a momentum indicator that is designed to identify overbought and oversold areas in a nontrending market..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionWMA
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The WMA (Weighted Moving Average) is a Moving Average indicator that shows the average value of a security's price over a period of time with special emphasis on the more recent portions of the time period under analysis as opposed to the earlier..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionZigZag
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The ZigZag indicator shows trend lines filtering out changes below a defined level..

member.name: P:NinjaTrader.Custom.Resource.NinjaScriptIndicatorDescriptionZLEMA
